thread.title: White House photos capture Obama in Roseburg
thread.title_full: White House photos capture Obama in Roseburg | OregonLive.com

author: Michelle Brence | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: White House photos capture Obama in Roseburg
text:
White House photographer Pete Souza posted four photos of President Barack Obama on his Instagram account from the president's visit Friday to Roseburg.
Souza captured images of the president with Oregon Gov. Kate Brown and Roseburg Mayor Larry Rich. He also photographed the president signing remembrances at Roseburg High School, where Obama met with families of victims of the Oct. 1 shooting at Roseburg's Umpqua Community College.
You can see the images here. If you missed coverage of the president's visit, you can catch up with our stories:
Obama visits Roseburg; 'It wasn't a discussion, it was a hug' Protesters in Roseburg declare 'Obama Free Zone,' display guns on hips, support sheriff Obama's public comments in Roseburg: full text President Obama hugs farewell to Gov. Kate Brown yesterday in Roseburg, Oregon. I love Oregon but I don't want to return to this state--or any state--for the reason we came here. We are too great a country for this.
A photo posted by Pete Souza (@petesouza) on Oct 10, 2015 at 11:17am PDT
President Obama signs some remembrances after greeting families of the victims in the mass school shooting in Roseburg, Oregon.
A photo posted by Pete Souza (@petesouza) on Oct 9, 2015 at 6:36pm PDT
President Obama walks to the motorcade with Oregon Gov. Kate Brown after visiting families of the victims in the mass school shooting in Roseburg, Oregon
A photo posted by Pete Souza (@petesouza) on Oct 9, 2015 at 5:56pm PDT
President Obama flanked by Roseburg Mayor Larry Rich and Oregon Gov. Kate Brown makes statement after visiting families of the victims in the mass shooting in Roseburg.
A photo posted by Pete Souza (@petesouza) on Oct 9, 2015 at 4:21pm PDT
